intro: Galium javanicum var. leiocarpum, commonly known as the smooth-fruited bedstraw, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that release tiny seeds when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks.
